messages.title: Building Strength
messages.content: Protecting the weak make us strong.

messages.title: Fighting for Britain
messages.content: Leading us out of global crisis.

messages.title: Why it matters
messages.content: It is a really humbling experience to represent you. I never thought I would twice be asked to serve as your MP, but I have always been driven to represent our community in the best way possible.

messages.title: Looking to our children's future
messages.content: My children are getting a great education at local state schools.

keyPolicies.policyDescription: It's essential that your MP is a genuine member of your local community, rooted in the area.
New school buildings, quality teaching and reducing waiting times are my priorities.

keyPolicies.policyTitle: Homes for families to grow strong
keyPolicies.policyDescription: Improving existing homes, building new homes on old sites whilst saving our countryside.

keyPolicies.policyTitle: New investment and good jobs in our local economy
keyPolicies.policyDescription: Maintaining jobs in a competitive world and bringing new high tech and green jobs.
I will continue to fight for a better life in later years, carers and a National Care Service.

issues.brexitEurope: Labour has made the right choices, It is vital that we continue to support the economy until recovery is secured.
issues.education: I promise an investment in technology and after school provision are already helping to improve standards. My first major speech was about Labour delivering the promise to cut class sizes, I want to transform our secondary schools the way we transformed our primary schools.
issues.health: We need to build on the first 11 years - from introducing free TV licences for pensioners to winter fuel allowances. We will build a National Care Service to match the rest of the NHS.
issues.socialWelfare: Throughout the global financial crisis, Labour has made the right choices. Helped Hard working families: We know how hard it is bringing up a family that is why Labour introduced Child Tax Credits and continue to raise them worth up to £2,235 for families and under threat from Cameron.

housing.content: Improving existing homes, building new homes on old sites whilst saving our countryside.

leaflet.personalStatement: It is a really humbling experience to represent you. I never thought I would twice be asked to serve as your MP, but I have always been driven to represent our community in the best way possible.

politicalExperience.achievements: My first major speech was about Labour delivering the promise to cut class sizes, the next task is to help transform our secondary schools the way we transformed our primary schools.

contactInformation.address: Unity House, 21 Fennel Street, Loughborough, LE11 1UQ

quotes.text: Throughout the global financial crisis, Labour has made the right choices, It is vital that we continue to support the economy until recovery is secured.
We know how hard it is bringing up a family that is why Labour introduced Child Tax Credits and continue to raise them worth up to £2,235 for families and under threat from Cameron.
We need to build on the first 11 years - from introducing free TV licenses for pensioners to winter fuel allowances. We will build a National Care Service to match the rest of the NHS.
